noun.description: A person who secretly collects and reports information on the activities, movements, and plans of an enemy or competitor.

verb.description: Work for a government or other organization by secretly collecting information about enemies or competitors.
examples: he agreed to spy for the West

origin: Middle English: shortening of Old French espie espying, espier espy, of Germanic origin, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin specere behold, look.
